title: All the candidates standing in the Rochdale by-election this month
description: The date for the Rochdale by-election is Thursday, February 29 - which means candidates have just under four weeks to try and win the support of voters. Here is the full list of candidates and the political parties they are representing:

title: Poll puts Hunt under pressure to cut income tax for low earners

title: Slash income tax for low and middle earners, voters tell Jeremy Hunt in poll
description: A majority of voters believe they are taxed too much and want the Chancellor to use next month’s Budget to slash income tax on low and middle earners, a poll suggests. More than half (53 per cent) said they are taxed too much, with no significant difference between supporters of Labour and the Conservatives, the BMG Research survey for i suggests.

title: Labour select candidate to fight newly formed Northumberland seat at general election
description: The Labour Party has unveiled its candidate for the newly formed Cramlington and Killingworth seat at the looming General Election.

title: Senior MP all but confirms Labour has dropped £28bn green investment target
description: Darren Jones says party will decide budget based on state of economy and individual projects if it wins election

title: Politics latest news: Labour starts pre-election talks with civil service
description: Reform UK has hit its highest ever level of support in crucial Red Wall seats, according to a new poll. A Redfield & Wilton Strategies survey, conducted between Jan 30-31, put Richard Tice’s party on 14 per cent of the vote. That was up by three points when compared to the company’s previous poll conducted between Dec 17-18.

title: Rishi Sunak must get a grip or go now, writes Robert Taylor

description: Capitol Hill abuzz for details of deal tying Ukraine aid to US immigration measures after fraught negotiations and attempts by Trump to derail it

title: Police boss apologises for comments on schoolgirls wearing 'very short skirts'
description: A police and crime commissioner is facing calls to resign over 'misogynistic' comments about schoolgirls wearing 'very short skirts'.

title: Labour unveils £10bn life sciences plan to boost UK pharmaceutical sector ahead of 2024 General Election
description: Labour said that under the Conservatives, the life sciences sector has declined, stating that the UK's share of global exports is down from 9% to 4%, with the share of global pharmaceutical R&D falling from 7.2% to 3.2% between 2012 and 2020.

title: Calls for ‘urgent’ Home Office review into alkali attack suspect’s asylum claim
description: The details of the case have renewed calls from some Tory MPs for serious reform of the asylum system, with former immigration minister Robert Jenrick calling on Home Secretary James Cleverly to carry out a “detailed review” of how Ezedi was allowed to remain in the UK.

title: “Independence may be viable option but not a desirable one”, said Wales’ first minister
Four trends you’ll see in online election campaigns this year
description: Over the past decade, social media has become an essential component of election campaigns. But in 2024, the options seem endless. With a record number of elections taking place around the world, how will digital campaigning look different this year?

title: Who still votes Conservative?
description: Gender, age, religion: the new faultlines in how the UK votes

title: It’s not just the Tories getting it badly wrong on tax and business...
description: Despite its 20-point lead, Labour is badly faltering on the issues that matter, writes Andrew Grice. Are Keir Starmer’s critics right to say that he represents a continuation of the same old status quo?

title: Labour leadership feel heat as they go cold over £28billion green plan
description: The opposition leadership has gone from a firm promise in 2021 to invest £28 billion a year on a “Green Prosperity Plan”, via increased borrowing, to merely an “ambition” to come up with the money in the second half of the next Parliament, subject to fiscal rules.

title: Sunak tells Tories they are like England cricket team – down but not out
description: The Conservatives have been trailing Labour in the polls by around 20 points for months – but the Tory leader told his troops this year’s general election could still be won. The PM made the comparison at a dinner with around 100 of his MPs on Thursday ...

title: Conservatives lose their minds over Jesus as a scantily clad white twink on a poster
description: A poster depicting Jesus Christ as a cute, white, scantily-clad youth has sparked controversy in Spain. As NBC News reports, the Council of Brotherhoods in Seville, Spain, commissioned renowned painter Salustiano García to create the arresting image for a poster promoting the city’s Easter festivities.

title: Conservatives resistances to tax credit expansion adds to tensions on immigration
description: House Republicans struggled to get on board with a tax plan that addresses childhood poverty over concerns about undocumented families. Now the bill heads to the Senate.

title: Fury as James Cleverly pleads for £2.6billion to plug Home Office asylum black hole
description: Tories have been accused of 'busting the budget' after Home Secretary James Cleverly said he needed an extra £2.6billion to plug a Home Office budget black hole

title: Sunak slammed as quarter of pharmacy budgets cut since 2015
description: The Liberal Democrats have slammed the Conservatives for failing pharmacies as reports show hundreds of millions of pounds worth of cuts since 2015.

title: I sat through the Brianna Ghey trial – this is what I learned as a trans person
description: The transphobia felt unbearable at times. Like when planning Brianna’s murder, the defendants exchanged messages including transphobic slurs and other transphobic material, such as references to her genitalia, questioning whether she would scream ‘like a man or a girl’ when killed, and Ratcliffe continually referred to her as an ‘it’.

title: Candidates for two Derbyshire Dales by-elections announced
description: Only two candidates have listed their home address, with four listing “Derbyshire Dales”. May’s elections saw the Conservatives retain the second Bakewell seat (now held by Gareth Gee) by 55 votes over Labour.

title: More Misery For Rishi Sunak As Poll Suggests Tories Could Win Fewer Than 100 Seats
description: The Techne survey showed support for the Conservatives has fallen again to just 23%, while Labour has gone up by one point to 45%. According to the Electoral Calculus website, that would put Rishi Sunak’s party on just 93 seats - a staggering 283 fewer than they won at the 2019 election.

title: Opinion: Don't believe Labour's bluster – the Lib Dems are best placed to dethrone the Tories...
description: The Liberal Democrats are the leading challengers to the Conservatives in the new Farnham Bordon constituency, contrary to another misleading claim from the local Labour Party in the Herald last week that they are best placed to beat the Conservatives when a General Election is called.

title: Why was chemical attack fugitive Abdul Ezedi granted asylum in UK AFTER being convicted of sex attack, MPs fume

title: Clapham chemical attack: 'Big questions' for government - as more details of chemical attack suspect's sexual crimes emerge
description: There are "big questions" for the Home Office after it emerged that the Clapham chemical attack suspect Abdul Shokoor Ezedi was granted asylum in either 2021 or 2022, despite having committed a sexual offence in 2018.

title: Europe’s Greens are on the ropes
description: Farmers’ ire and a right-wing surge is testing the EU’s climate goals. And the Greens that backed them are teetering.

title: Labour refuses to say if it still supports £28bn green investment pledge
description: Shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves has repeatedly refused to set out whether she is standing by her commitment to spend £28 billion a year on green investment

title: SNP and Labour on course to win same number of Westminster seats, poll suggests
description: The SNP and Labour will win the same number of seats at the next general election, a new poll suggests. A survey for advisory firm True North by Survation questioned 1,029 people between January 23 and 25, and put Humza Yousaf’s party on 36% of decided likely voters, while Labour is on 34%.

title: Tories dine at the happy families hotel
description: HAPPY FAMILIES: Some 476 days after using it to mourn second place in the leadership contest, Rishi Sunak returned on Thursday night to Leicester Square’s “super boutique” Londoner hotel to tell more than 100 Tory MPs he can definitely win the election. Honest.

description: There are "big questions" for the Home Office after it emerged that the Clapham chemical attack suspect Abdul Shokoor Ezedi was granted asylum in either 2021 or 2022, despite having committed a sexual offence in 2018.

title: BC NDP maintaining a sizeable lead in latest polls
description: A Research Co. poll of decided voters gives Premier David Eby’s New Democrats a double-digit lead over the second-placed Conservative Party of BC with 46 per cent share versus 26 per cent. Research Co. conducted the poll online between Jan. 22 to Jan. 24.

title: SNP and Labour set to win same number of seats in Scotland at 2024 General Election, poll suggests
description: The Scottish Conservatives polled 16% and the Scottish Liberal Democrats 8%, with 7% opting for other parties. Analysis of the results by polling expert Professor Sir John Curtice puts the two parties level on 23 seats, a drop from 48 won by the SNP in ...

title: Rishi Sunak's Tories heading for less than 100 seats as fears of complete wipeout explode
description: EXCLUSIVE: A leading pollster has warned that the public "have made up their minds on the Conservatives" as Labour's massive lead grows again.
